column4: while partitioning my hard drive on my laptop, I got the following error message: "BOOTBCD.LOG is 9 k, but has 33 clusters(132k)."  what does this mean?
I think that means you have a filesystem corruption.  The file size and the space on disk are inconsistent.  Try checking your file system.

if it's a recovery partition it is probably a bit weird.  Some vendors intentionally put errors in those file systems so they won't show up in windows.  It usually just contains a backup windows installation.
